image.altText: Track map 7.33am 21-11 jpg

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has declared a cyclone warning for Darwin as Cyclone Fina intensifies while tracking towards the Northern Territory capital.

title.children: BOM declares cyclone warning for Darwin as Fina tracks south-west

image.altText: A white woman in a black linen vest and pants, walking out of a building, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Building company director Jessica Buckley is the fourth person charged with fraud over an alleged $71 million Department of Defence contracts scandal.

title.children: Fourth person charged over alleged $71m Defence contracts fraud

image.altText: A close-up of a prison guard's badge.

props.synopsis: The officials who manage the Northern Territory's prison system say a new framework will replace a "fragmented" rehabilitation model that was not based on evidence, as the department moves "from crisis to reform".

title.children: NT prisons set to shift 'from crisis to reform' under new rehabilitation plan

image.altText: The weather bureau's cyclone track map

props.synopsis: The BOM's latest track map shows Tropical Cyclone Fina has been temporarily downgraded to a category one system, but could still intensify to a category three by Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Cyclone Fina may be category three when it reaches Darwin, BOM says

image.altText: An elderly man sits on an armchair, his daughter sits beside him on another chair.

props.synopsis: A 92-year-old man and his daughter are calling for the Department of Housing to install better security at a block of Alice Springs housing commission units, after a series of assaults on elderly residents.

title.children: Calls for security to be 'ramped up' at Alice Springs units

image.altText: A woman with short blonde hair sits under a verandah at a table strewn with jars, leaves, flower and photo frames.

props.synopsis: Small business owners in Alice Springs encourage residents to spend at locally owned stores this Christmas to keep money circulating in the community.

title.children: Alice Springs businesses say ditch Temu and Shein to support local stockists

image.altText: Serious Ned has a red band around his forehead, grey beard and moustache, wears an Indigenous-print shirt, background blurred.

props.synopsis: Kumanjayi White investigation continues six months on from his death as the Department of Public Prosecutions awaits "the provision of further material" from NT Police. But the family says the findings are taking too long.

title.children: Death in custody ruling delayed as DPP requests details from NT Police

image.altText: Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has accused Chris Bowen of being a "part-time energy minister" after he stuck a deal to take up a negotiator role for COP31. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition accuses Chris Bowen of being a 'part-time energy minister'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Twitch added to social media ban
Sussan Ley says Bowen is a 'globetrotting' and 'part-time energy minister'
Hawke says Liberal party has 'brand issues' after resignation of NSW Liberal leader

image.altText: Gif showing illustration of a house with household items and a fighter jet flying above.

props.synopsis: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

title.children: How critical minerals power our daily lives from the moment we wake up

image.altText: A space station in orbit over a cloudy day on Earth.

props.synopsis: Moss has the potential to provide food for astronauts of the future, according to a study that exposed one of Earth's oldest plants to the extremes of space travel.

title.children: Super-tough moss survives nine months in space strapped to the ISS

image.altText: Share trader

props.synopsis: The ASX is down sharply after Wall Street lurched from early gains to steep losses, in what analysts are calling the "wildest session" since the Liberation Day tariff fallout in April. Follow the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX falls nearly 2pc after Wall St's 'wildest session' since Liberation Day fallout

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Big four' banks and mining giants caught in ASX 'sell down'
Treasurer blocks proposed Cosette takeover of Mayne Pharma, shares plunge 23% before halt
Every sector on the ASX 200 is falling, with most stocks trading lower

image.altText: GettyImages-2247567883

props.synopsis: When Brendan Doggett receives his cap today, he joins the sparse ranks of Indigenous Australian Test players.

title.children: Doggett's Test debut represents a 150-year first for cricket

image.altText: A drone explodes during a Russian missile and drone strike in kyiv

props.synopsis: European allies of Kyiv say "peace cannot be capitulation" as details of a new plan to end the Ukraine war emerge.

title.children: 'Capitulation': Everything we know about new US plans to end war in Ukraine

image.altText: A greater glider on a branch at nighttime

props.synopsis: New data points to the "systemic" under-reporting of greater glider dens within areas earmarked for logging in NSW, which scientists say could result in localised extinctions.

title.children: 'Absolute madness': Environment groups decry glider survey results

image.altText: A woman with brown shoulder-length hair sits looking away from the camera with people sitting behind her

props.synopsis: Former mayor Alice Guo has generated headlines for years in the Philippines. Now, her story might have come to an end.

title.children: Philippines mayor sentenced to life in prison for human trafficking

image.altText: People use fire extinguishers to put out a fire at COP30

props.synopsis: Officials say the fire, which erupted at one of the country exhibition pavilions, was brought under control in six minutes as security personnel ordered thousands of delegates in the sprawling building to go outside.

title.children: Thirteen people treated for smoke inhalation after fire at COP30 venue

image.altText: A hot pink sky with flicks of yellow over a field.

props.synopsis: Did you catch the finer details of this week's news? Quiz yourself!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The ARIA Awards, a golden auction and aurora australis

image.altText: Marm Fowler warming up for a Matildas match in 2025.

props.synopsis: Montpellier responds to racism allegations made by Matildas forward Mary Fowler, who says a teammate gave her bananas as a departing gift in 2022.

title.children: French football club denies Fowler's racism allegation

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskiy welcomes a top us army official, they are shaking hands

props.synopsis: The White House says senior Trump administration officials have met Ukrainian officials in the past week to discuss the plan.

title.children: Zelenskyy ready to work on US-backed plan to end war in Ukraine

image.altText: Kellie Sloane left in black blazer, Chris Minns right in suit. Both up close photos.

props.synopsis: The premier faces one of his toughest challenges yet against the former television journalist-turned-CEO.

title.children: Why the premier is worried about the new leader of the NSW Libs

image.altText: Ms Sloane in a blue blazer smiles as she talks into microphones at a media press conference with another woman behind her

props.synopsis: Former shadow health minister Ms Sloane was endorsed by Mr Speakman during a press conference announcing his resignation on Thursday afternoon and elected unopposed this morning.

title.children: 'I'm ready to work': Kellie Sloane elected NSW Liberal leader

image.altText: bass guitarist gary mounfield screams while on stage in a purple shirt

props.synopsis: Mounfield was a member of the classic Stone Roses line-up for their 1989 self-titled debut album, which featured hits such as I Wanna Be Adored, She Bangs The Drums, and I Am The Resurrection.

title.children: Former Stone Roses bassist Gary 'Mani' Mounfield dies aged 63

image.altText: Sussan Ley speak to the media.

props.synopsis: The opposition has identified seven key areas where change would be required for the Coalition to support Labor's proposed reforms to the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act.

title.children: Coalition would back Labor's environment laws with 'sensible' amendments

image.altText: Six men in military uniform carry a casket draped in the US flag.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden, George Bush and every living former vice-president — Kamala Harris, Mike Pence, Al Gore and Dan Quayle — were in attendance, along with generals, foreign dignitaries and Supreme Court justices.

title.children: US elite gathers for Dick Cheney's funeral but Trump and Vance not invited

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Six Democratic politicians, all of whom are veterans, are urging members of the military not to obey unlawful orders.

title.children: Trump floats death penalty for Democrats urging military to refuse illegal orders

image.altText: A man in a suit stands in a lecturn with microphones in front of a Noosa Council banner.

props.synopsis: A year after Gold Coast Council was victim to a fraud attack, Noosa council was also targeted by a sophisticated artificial intelligence scam.

title.children: Queensland councils scammed out of millions despite warnings

image.altText: A long old submarine in the water

props.synopsis: The discovery of narco subs bearing the hallmarks of boats used by Mexican and South American drug cartels has intensified warnings that international syndicates are increasingly targeting the lucrative Australian and New Zealand illicit drug markets.

title.children: Escalating gangland violence tied to growing illicit drug trade

image.altText: Close up of hemp leaves

props.synopsis: A trial showing industrial hemp can be grown year-round has farmers excited about the crop's "huge" potential.

title.children: Winter trial could be key to unlocking 'huge' industrial hemp industry

image.altText: More than a dozen empty bunkbeds in a dormitory.

props.synopsis: The kidnappers arrived on motorcycles, scaled the school fence and shot the vice-principal as he tried to protect his students.

title.children: Nigeria grapples with mass abductions of schoolgirls

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists is calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

title.children: Push for national approach to ADHD diagnoses as states forge different paths

image.altText: graphic representation of children holding hands and toys

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the state's "broken" child protection system hears from staff who work at the child safety department.

title.children: Application to remove 66 newborns made in one region in 4 years, inquiry reveals

image.altText: Archie Ludowyke pictured representing the national academy

props.synopsis: Archie Ludowyke goes to his bedroom thinking he is not going to get his AFL dream realised, only to to hear an eruption from his living room as his name is called out by the Adelaide Crows.

title.children: Heartbroken draftee retreats to room in tears, misses moment he is picked

image.altText: A large white ferry sits in the water and up against a small island at night

props.synopsis: South Korean authorities have detained two crew members after the ferry carrying 267 passengers crashed into an island.

title.children: Ferry operator crashed vessel because he was distracted by his phone

image.altText: The waxwork of late Britain's Princess Diana is presented in a museum

props.synopsis: The late Princess is displayed wearing a copy of the black gown by designer Christina Stambolian that she wore for a public appearance in 1994 amid a media frenzy about the breakdown of her marriage to Charles.

title.children: Princess Diana enters Paris waxwork museum in 'revenge dress'
